page.title: 05SUMMERFORD, FAIRWARP
page.content: In June several people from my class went to meet an artist. He draws and paints the wild life of Ashdown forest. Our headmistress took us to see him. We asked him a few questions. He told us that he usually did a sketch using quite a few chalks. For some paintings it would take him about six hours including the sketch. He paints it in either oils or water colours. His house is called Summerford because there is a splash and one can only go through it in summer. At other times it is too deep. The Forestry commission looks after Furnace Wood. Its name reminds us of the iron works at Oldlands and the need for fuel for the furnaces. The wood is mixed. We saw oak, birch, willow and spruce. There were many plants, honeysuckle and brambles. A river runs past the Witch's stone.
